cards.name: Twiddle
cards.text: You may tap or untap target artifact, creature, or land.

rulings.text: This is not a toggle effect. If you use Twiddle to tap a card and before it takes effect your opponent taps it, Twiddle will not automatically untap the card.
The decision whether or not to tap or untap is made on resolution. This is not a modal spell.

cards.originalText: Tap or untap target artifact, creature, or land.

cards.name: Unsummon
cards.text: Return target creature to its owner's hand.
cards.originalText: Return target creature to its owner's hand.

cards.name: Wall of Air
cards.text: Defender, flying (This creature can't attack, and it can block creatures with flying.)
cards.flavor:
When no falcons fly, beware the sky.
—Femeref aphorism
cards.originalText:
(Walls can't attack.)
Flying (This creature may block creatures with flying.)

cards.name: Wind Drake
cards.text: Flying
cards.flavor:
"But high she shoots through air and light,
Above all low delay,
Where nothing earthly bounds her flight,
Nor shadow dims her way."
—Thomas Moore, "Oh that I had Wings"
cards.originalText: Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying.)

cards.name: Wrath of Marit Lage
cards.text:
When Wrath of Marit Lage enters the battlefield, tap all red creatures.
Red creatures don't untap during their controllers' untap steps.
cards.flavor:
"Marit Lage lies frozen in a glacier's heart. Still her dreams take form in our world, stealing the heat from our souls."
—Halvor Arenson, Kjeldoran priest
cards.originalText:
When Wrath of Marit Lage comes into play, tap all red creatures.
Red creatures don't untap during their controllers' untap steps.

cards.name: Zur's Weirding
cards.text:
Players play with their hands revealed.
If a player would draw a card, they reveal it instead. Then any other player may pay 2 life. If a player does, put that card into its owner's graveyard. Otherwise, that player draws a card.

rulings.text: If someone pays the cost, then the card was never drawn or discarded. It just gets put into the graveyard directly from the library.
This is a continuous replacement effect that modifies a draw.
If a spell or ability causes more than one card to be drawn, draw the cards one at a time and deal with this replacement before drawing the next card.

When using Dredge with this, you have two choices. You can immediately replace the draw with Dredge, or you can apply Zur's Weirding's replacement. If the latter, you first resolve Zur's Weirding's ability, then if you're going to draw the card, decide whether or not to replace that draw with Dredge.

cards.originalText:
Players play with their hands revealed.
If a player would draw a card, he or she reveals it instead. Then any other player may pay 2 life. If a player does, put that card into its owner's graveyard. Otherwise, that player draws the card.

cards.name: Abyssal Specter
cards.text:
Flying
Whenever Abyssal Specter deals damage to a player, that player discards a card.
cards.flavor: To gaze under its hood is to invite death.
cards.originalText:
Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying.)
Whenever Abyssal Specter deals damage to a player, that player discards a card from his or her hand.

cards.name: Ambition's Cost
cards.text: You draw three cards and you lose 3 life.

cards.originalText: You draw three cards and you lose 3 life.

"Ha, banishment? Be merciful, say 'death,'
For exile hath more terror in his look,
Much more than death."

cards.originalText: Destroy target nonblack creature. It can't be regenerated.

When Death Pit Offering comes into play, sacrifice all creatures you control.

cards.name: Grave Pact
cards.text: Whenever a creature you control dies, each other player sacrifices a creature.

rulings.text: Each other player sacrifices a creature for each creature you control that goes to a graveyard.

cards.name: Gravedigger
cards.text: When Gravedigger enters the battlefield, you may return target creature card from your graveyard to your hand.
cards.flavor: A full coffin is like a full coffer—both are attractive to thieves.

rulings.text: A "creature card" is any card with the type creature, even if it has other types such as artifact, enchantment, or land. Older cards of type summon are also creature cards.

cards.originalText: When Gravedigger comes into play, you may return target creature card from your graveyard to your hand.

cards.name: Nightmare
cards.text:
Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
Nightmare's power and toughness are each equal to the number of Swamps you control.
cards.flavor: The thunder of its hooves beats dreams into despair.

rulings.text: If you control 0 swamps, then the Nightmare has 0 toughness and will be put into its owner's graveyard as a state-based action right before the next player gains priority.
Nightmare's power and toughness changes as the number of Swamps you control changes.
The ability that defines Nightmare's power and toughness works everywhere, not just on the battlefield.
Nightmare's ability counts all lands you control with the subtype Swamp, not just ones named Swamp.

cards.originalText:
Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying.)

cards.name: Balduvian Barbarians
cards.flavor:
"From the snowy slopes of Kaelor,
To the canyons of Bandu,
We drink and fight and feast and die
As we were born to do."
—Balduvian tavern song

cards.name: Blaze
cards.text: Blaze deals X damage to any target.
cards.flavor: Fire never dies alone.
cards.originalText: Blaze deals X damage to target creature or player.

cards.name: Blood Moon
cards.text: Nonbasic lands are Mountains.
cards.flavor: Heavy light flooded across the landscape, cloaking everything in deep crimson.

rulings.text: If a nonbasic land has an ability that causes it to enter the battlefield tapped, it will lose that ability before it applies. The same is also true of any other abilities that modify how a land enters the battlefield or apply "as" a land enters the battlefield, such as the first ability of Cavern of Souls. This is a change from previous rulings.
Nonbasic lands will lose any other land types and abilities they had. They will gain the land type Mountain and gain the ability "{T}: Add {R}."
This effect doesn't affect names or supertypes. It won't turn any land into a basic land or remove the legendary supertype from a legendary land, and the lands won't be named "Mountain."
If a nonbasic land has an ability that triggers "when" it enters the battlefield, it will lose that ability before it triggers.

cards.originalText: Nonbasic lands are Mountains.

cards.name: Bloodshot Cyclops
cards.text: {T}, Sacrifice a creature: Bloodshot Cyclops deals damage equal to the sacrificed creature's power to any target.
cards.flavor: After their first encounter, the goblins named him Chuck.
cards.originalText: {T}, Sacrifice a creature: Bloodshot Cyclops deals damage equal to the sacrificed creature's power to target creature or player.

cards.name: Boil
cards.text: Destroy all Islands.
cards.flavor: "When every reef is bared and every wave is dust—only then shall I rest."
cards.originalText: Destroy all Islands.

cards.name: Canyon Wildcat
cards.text: Mountainwalk (This creature can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Mountain.)
cards.flavor: In the warrior kingdom of Keld, the cats used in the hunt are prized for their tracking sense and ability to climb walls.
cards.originalText: Mountainwalk (This creature is unblockable as long as defending player controls a Mountain.)

cards.text:
Defender
When Cinder Wall blocks, destroy it at end of combat.

"The smell of roasted flesh hung over the valley for hours."
—Onean sergeant

When Cinder Wall blocks, destroy it at end of combat.

cards.text: Destroy target artifact or land.
cards.flavor:
"Pound the steel until it fits.
Doesn't work? Bash to bits."
—Dwarven forging song

cards.name: Dwarven Demolition Team
cards.text: {T}: Destroy target Wall.
cards.flavor: Foolishly, Najib retreated to his castle at El-Abar; the next morning he was dead. In just one night, the dwarven forces had reduced the mighty walls to mere rubble.

cards.name: Enrage
cards.text: Target creature gets +X/+0 until end of turn.
cards.flavor: "You wouldn't like me when I'm angry."

cards.name: Flashfires

cards.flavor: Dry grass is tinder before the spark.

cards.name: Furnace of Rath
cards.text: If a source would deal damage to a permanent or player, it deals double that damage to that permanent or player instead.
cards.flavor: The furnace awaits the next master who would stoke the fires of apocalypse.

rulings.text: If a spell or ability damages multiple things, divide up the damage before applying this effect. This means you can't normally end up with an odd amount of damage on something.
The trample rules cause damage to be divided before it is doubled.
If you have two of these on the battlefield, the damage is multiplied by 4.
The multiplied damage counts in all ways as if it came from the original source. Furnace of Rath is not the source.

If multiple effects modify how damage will be dealt, the player who would be dealt damage or the controller of the creature that would be dealt damage chooses the order to apply the effects. For example, Mending Hands says, "Prevent the next 4 damage that would be dealt to any target this turn." Suppose a spell would deal 5 damage to a player who has cast Mending Hands targeting themselves. That player can either (a) prevent 4 damage first and then let Furnace of Rath double the remaining 1 damage, taking 2 damage, or (b) double the damage to 10 and then prevent 4 damage, taking 6 damage.

cards.originalText: If a source would deal damage to a creature or player, it deals double that damage to that creature or player instead.

cards.name: Goblin Chariot
cards.text: Haste (This creature can attack and {T} as soon as it comes under your control.)
cards.flavor: The hardest part of his training is learning not to eat the boar.

cards.name: Goblin Glider

Flying

Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying.)
Goblin Glider can't block.

cards.name: Goblin King
cards.text: Other Goblin creatures get +1/+1 and have mountainwalk. (They can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Mountain.)
cards.flavor: To be king, Numsgil did in Blog, who did in Unkful, who did in Viddle, who did in Loll, who did in Alrok. . . .

rulings.text: Goblin King now has the Goblin creature type and its ability has been reworded to affect *other* Goblins. This means that if two Goblin Kings are on the battlefield, each gives the other a bonus.

cards.originalText: All Goblins get +1/+1 and have mountainwalk. (They're unblockable as long as defending player controls a Mountain.)

cards.name: Goblin Raider
cards.text: Goblin Raider can't block.
cards.flavor: He's smart for a goblin. He can do two things: hit and run.
cards.originalText: Goblin Raider can't block.

cards.name: Guerrilla Tactics
cards.text:
Guerrilla Tactics deals 2 damage to any target.
When a spell or ability an opponent controls causes you to discard Guerrilla Tactics, Guerrilla Tactics deals 4 damage to any target.

rulings.text: If it is discarded, the damage done by it is done by this card due to an ability and not by a spell.
The second ability will trigger even on an optional discard caused by an opponent.
Discarding as a cost to cast a spell will not trigger the ability. Only discarding as an effect will trigger the ability.

cards.originalText:
Guerrilla Tactics deals 2 damage to target creature or player.
When a spell or ability an opponent controls causes you to discard Guerrilla Tactics from your hand, Guerrilla Tactics deals 4 damage to target creature or player.

cards.name: Hammer of Bogardan
cards.text:
Hammer of Bogardan deals 3 damage to any target.
{2}{R}{R}{R}: Return Hammer of Bogardan from your graveyard to your hand. Activate this ability only during your upkeep.
cards.originalText:
Hammer of Bogardan deals 3 damage to target creature or player.
{2}{R}{R}{R}: Return Hammer of Bogardan from your graveyard to your hand. Play this ability only during your upkeep. (Your upkeep step is after you untap and before you draw.)

cards.name: Hill Giant
cards.flavor: Bent on a quest for blood, a giant can storm through a fort's wall as if it were nothing more than a picket fence.

cards.name: Hulking Cyclops
cards.text: Hulking Cyclops can't block.
cards.flavor: Anyone can get around a cyclops, but few can stand in its way.
cards.originalText: Hulking Cyclops can't block.

cards.name: Inferno
cards.text: Inferno deals 6 damage to each creature and each player.
cards.flavor:
"Some have said there is no subtlety to destruction. You know what? They're dead."
—Jaya Ballard, task mage
cards.originalText: Inferno deals 6 damage to each creature and each player.

cards.name: Lava Axe
cards.text: Lava Axe deals 5 damage to target player or planeswalker.
cards.flavor: "Catch!"
cards.originalText: Lava Axe deals 5 damage to target player.

cards.name: Lava Hounds
cards.text:
Haste
When Lava Hounds enters the battlefield, it deals 4 damage to you.
cards.originalText:
Haste (This creature may attack the turn it comes under your control.)
When Lava Hounds comes into play, it deals 4 damage to you.

cards.name: Lesser Gargadon
cards.text: Whenever Lesser Gargadon attacks or blocks, sacrifice a land.
cards.flavor:
"In some cultures, elephants are ridden by those in power. I don't think a mere elephant would even be noticed in Keld."
—Onean sergeant
cards.originalText: Whenever Lesser Gargadon attacks or blocks, sacrifice a land.

cards.name: Lightning Blast
cards.text: Lightning Blast deals 4 damage to any target.
cards.flavor:
"Those who fear the darkness have never seen what the light can do."
—Selenia, dark angel
cards.originalText: Lightning Blast deals 4 damage to target creature or player.

cards.name: Lightning Elemental
cards.text: Haste (This creature can attack and {T} as soon as it comes under your control.)
cards.flavor:
"A flash of the lightning, a break of the wave,
He passes from life to his rest in the grave."
—William Knox, "Mortality"
cards.originalText: Haste (This creature may attack the turn it comes under your control.)

cards.name: Mana Clash
cards.text: You and target opponent each flip a coin. Mana Clash deals 1 damage to each player whose coin comes up tails. Repeat this process until both players' coins come up heads on the same flip.

rulings.text: Always affects the player and targets one of their opponents.
Each point of damage is dealt separately, so if you are damaged twice by this spell, each time is considered a separate time this source deals damage.
This card's coin flip has no winner or loser.

cards.originalText: You and target opponent each flip a coin. Mana Clash deals 1 damage to each player whose coin comes up tails. Repeat this process until both players' coins come up heads on the same flip.

cards.name: Mogg Sentry
cards.text: Whenever an opponent casts a spell, Mogg Sentry gets +2/+2 until end of turn.
cards.flavor: Tortured with magic by their masters, the moggs are enflamed by the smell of sorcery.
cards.originalText: Whenever an opponent plays a spell, Mogg Sentry gets +2/+2 until end of turn.

cards.name: Obliterate
cards.text:
This spell can't be countered.
Destroy all artifacts, creatures, and lands. They can't be regenerated.
cards.flavor:
"The enemy has been destroyed, sir. So have the forest, the city, your palace, your dog . . ."
—Keldon soldier

rulings.text: Counterspells can be cast that target it, but when they resolve they simply don't counter it since it can't be countered.

cards.originalText:
Obliterate can't be countered.
Destroy all artifacts, creatures, and lands. They can't be regenerated.

cards.name: Ogre Taskmaster
cards.text: Ogre Taskmaster can't block.
cards.flavor: Ogres learn how to smash stuff even before they learn how to walk.
cards.originalText: Ogre Taskmaster can't block.

cards.name: Okk
cards.text:
Okk can't attack unless a creature with greater power also attacks.
Okk can't block unless a creature with greater power also blocks.
cards.originalText:
Okk can't attack unless a creature with greater power also attacks.
Okk can't block unless a creature with greater power also blocks.

cards.name: Orcish Artillery
cards.text: {T}: Orcish Artillery deals 2 damage to any target and 3 damage to you.
cards.flavor:
"So they want to kill my men? Well two can play at that game."
—General Khurzog

rulings.text: You do not take the 3 points of damage if the ability doesn't resolve because the target is illegal.

cards.originalText: {T}: Orcish Artillery deals 2 damage to target creature or player and 3 damage to you.

cards.name: Orcish Spy
cards.text: {T}: Look at the top three cards of target player's library.
cards.flavor:
"You idiot Never let the spies mingle with the orcish regulars after completing a mission. Now we'll never get them to fight"
—General Khurzog
cards.originalText: {T}: Look at the top three cards of target player's library. (Put them back in the same order.)

cards.name: Panic Attack
cards.text: Up to three target creatures can't block this turn.
cards.flavor: Sometimes everyone decides to go for help at the same time.
cards.originalText: Up to three target creatures can't block this turn.

cards.name: Pyroclasm
cards.text: Pyroclasm deals 2 damage to each creature.
cards.flavor:
"When the air burns, only death breathes deep."
—Bogardan mage
cards.originalText: Pyroclasm deals 2 damage to each creature.
